definition: overjoyed at unexpected good news (idiom)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad
(experienced action marker)
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards

sentences.english: The yuan non-deliverable forward market isn't expecting significant appreciation for the next year.
sentences.chinese: 讓市場大喜過望的人民幣在下一年完整不被看好。

sentences.english: "The students are just overjoyed, " says MIT architecture associate professor John Ochsendorf.
sentences.chinese: “學生們大喜過望，”MIT建築學會的教授J說。

sentences.english: The outcome of the game is beyond his fondest hopes.
sentences.chinese: 比賽結果使他大喜過望。

sentences.english: He'll be overjoyed at your news .
sentences.chinese: 他一定對你的消息大喜過望。

sentences.english: He'll is overjoyed at your news.
sentences.chinese: 他一定對你的消息大喜過望。

sentences.english: Montayne now, the press will have a field day.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們現在推遲蒙太尼，新聞界就會大喜過望。

sentences.english: If we delay Montayne now, the press will have a field day.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們現在推遲蒙太尼，新聞界就會大喜過望。

sentences.english: Milan chief executive Adriano Galliani was overjoyed to re-sign Shevchenko.
sentences.chinese: 對於再次簽下舍瓦，米蘭主席加里亞尼簡直大喜過望。

sentences.english: Those people were overjoyed; they took to their boats.
sentences.chinese: 人們大喜過望，紛紛登上船隻。

sentences.english: Chen heard after three guns overjoyed, immediately agreed.
sentences.chinese: 陳三炮聽到以後大喜過望，當即同意了。

sentences.english: Aladdin was overjoyed, but, saying little, retired to his chamber.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉丁大喜過望，但不聲不響地回到自己房間中。

sentences.english: She has accepted his invitation and he is overjoyed.
sentences.chinese: 她接受了他的邀請，而他則是大喜過望。

definition: sullen/to scowl miserably
to turn pale with fright (idiom)
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
the State of Qǐ in modern Qǐ county 杞縣|杞县, Henan (c. 1500-445 BC), a small vassal state of Shang and Western Zhou for most of its existence
to hate and resent/angry and full of grievances
red in the face/extremely angry
to transmit an order
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
to sign/to make one's mark
dejected/despondent/depressed
see 臨陣退縮|临阵退缩[lin2 zhen4 tui4 suo1]
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
unexpected misfortune/unexpected accident/sudden death
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
